Dwarf Scroll I.name: Dwarf Scroll I
Dwarf Scroll I.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a red bow.

Dwarf Scroll II.name: Dwarf Scroll II
Dwarf Scroll II.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.

Dwarf Scroll III.name: Dwarf Scroll III
Dwarf Scroll III.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a blue rope.
locations: Several monsters drop (1.5% for Blue Slime, 0.5% for others)

Dwarf Scroll IV.name: Dwarf Scroll IV
Dwarf Scroll IV.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a golden chain.
locations: Any Monster (other than Serpent, Skeleton, Wilderness Golem, Carbon Ghost, Iridium Bat, Iridium Crab, and Haunted Skull) (0.1%)

Chipped Amphora.name: Chipped Amphora
Chipped Amphora.description: An ancient vessel made of ceramic material. Used to transport both dry and wet goods.

Arrowhead.name: Arrowhead
Arrowhead.description: A crudely fashioned point used for hunting.

Ancient Doll.name: Ancient Doll
Ancient Doll.description: An ancient doll covered in grime. This doll may have been used as a toy, a decoration, or a prop in some kind of ritual.

Elvish Jewelry.name: Elvish Jewelry
Elvish Jewelry.description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elvish bones have ever been found.

Chewing Stick.name: Chewing Stick
Chewing Stick.description: Ancient people chewed on these to keep their teeth clean.

Ornamental Fan.name: Ornamental Fan
Ornamental Fan.description: This exquisute fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era vacation spot for the wealthy.

Dinosaur Egg.name: Dinosaur Egg
Dinosaur Egg.description: A giant dino egg... The entire shell is still intact!
locations: Foraged on prehistoric floors of the Skull Cavern

Rare Disc.name: Rare Disc
Rare Disc.description: A heavy black disc studded with peculiar red stones. When you hold it, you're overwhelmed with a feeling of dread.
locations: Shadow Brute, Shadow Shaman, Spider drop (0.3%)

Ancient Sword.name: Ancient Sword
Ancient Sword.description: It's the remains of an ancient sword. Most of the blade has turned to rust, but the hilt is very finely crafted.

Rusty Spoon.name: Rusty Spoon
Rusty Spoon.description: A plain old spoon, probably ten years old. Not very interesting.

Rusty Spur.name: Rusty Spur
Rusty Spur.description: An old spur that was once attached to a cowboy's boot. People must have been raising animals in this area for many generations.

Rusty Cog.name: Rusty Cog
Rusty Cog.description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarven technology.

Chicken Statue.name: Chicken Statue
Chicken Statue.description: It's a statue of a chicken on a bronze base. The ancient people of this area must have been very fond of chickens.

Ancient Seed.name: Ancient Seed
Ancient Seed.description: It's a dry old seed from some ancient plant. By all appearances it's long since dead...
locations: Monster drop (Bug, Cave Fly, Grub, Mutant Fly, Mutant Grub: 0.5%)

Prehistoric Tool.name: Prehistoric Tool
Prehistoric Tool.description: Some kind of gnarly old digging tool.

Dried Starfish.name: Dried Starfish
Dried Starfish.description: A starfish from the primordial ocean. It's an unusually pristine specimen!

Anchor.name: Anchor
Anchor.description: It may have belonged to ancient pirates.

Glass Shards.name: Glass Shards
Glass Shards.description: A mixture of glass shards smoothed by centuries of ocean surf. These could have belonged to an ancient mosaic or necklace.

Bone Flute.name: Bone Flute
Bone Flute.description: It's a prehistoric wind instrument carved from an animal's bone. It produces an eerie tone.

Prehistoric Handaxe.name: Prehistoric Handaxe
Prehistoric Handaxe.description: One of the earliest tools employed by humans. This "crude" tool was created by striking one rock with another to form a sharp edge.

Dwarvish Helm.name: Dwarvish Helm
Dwarvish Helm.description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.

Dwarf Gadget.name: Dwarf Gadget
Dwarf Gadget.description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.

Ancient Drum.name: Ancient Drum
Ancient Drum.description: It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone.

Golden Mask.name: Golden Mask
Golden Mask.description: A creepy golden mask probably used in an ancient magic ritual. A socket in the forehead contains a large purple gemstone.

Golden Relic.name: Golden Relic
Golden Relic.description: It's a golden slab with heiroglyphs and pictures emblazoned onto the front.

Prehistoric Scapula.name: Prehistoric Scapula
Prehistoric Scapula.description: Commonly known as a "shoulder blade"... It's unclear what species it belonged to.

Prehistoric Tibia.name: Prehistoric Tibia
Prehistoric Tibia.description: A thick and sturdy leg bone.

Prehistoric Skull.name: Prehistoric Skull
Prehistoric Skull.description: This is definitely a mammalian skull.

Skeletal Hand.name: Skeletal Hand
Skeletal Hand.description: It's a wonder all these ancient little pieces lasted so long.

Prehistoric Rib.name: Prehistoric Rib
Prehistoric Rib.description: Little gouge marks on the side suggest that this rib was someone's dinner.

Prehistoric Vertebra.name: Prehistoric Vertebra
Prehistoric Vertebra.description: A segment of some prehistoric creature's spine.

Skeletal Tail.name: Skeletal Tail
Skeletal Tail.description: It's pretty short for a tail.

Nautilus Fossil.name: Nautilus Fossil
Nautilus Fossil.description: This must've washed up ages ago from an ancient coral reef.

Amphibian Fossil.name: Amphibian Fossil
Amphibian Fossil.description: The relatively short hind legs suggest some kind of primordial toad.

Palm Fossil.name: Palm Fossil
Palm Fossil.description: Palm Fossils are relatively common, but this happens to be a particularly well-preserved specimen.

Trilobite.name: Trilobite
Trilobite.description: A long extinct relative of the crab.

Quartz.name: Quartz
Quartz.description: A clear crystal commonly found in caves and mines.

Earth Crystal.name: Earth Crystal
Earth Crystal.description: A resinous substance found near the surface.

Frozen Tear.name: Frozen Tear
Frozen Tear.description: A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti.

Fire Quartz.name: Fire Quartz
Fire Quartz.description: A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava.

Emerald.name: Emerald
Emerald.description: A precious stone with a brilliant green color.

Ruby.name: Ruby
Ruby.description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich color and beautiful luster.

Topaz.name: Topaz
Topaz.description: Fairly common but still prized for its beauty.

Prismatic Shard.name: Prismatic Shard
Prismatic Shard.description: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.

Tigerseye.name: Tigerseye
Tigerseye.description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm luster.

Opal.name: Opal
Opal.description: Its internal structure causes it to reflect a rainbow of light.

Fire Opal.name: Fire Opal
Fire Opal.description: A rare variety of opal, named for its red spots.

Alamite.name: Alamite
Alamite.description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favorite among rock collectors.

Bixite.name: Bixite
Bixite.description: A dark metallic Mineral sought after for its cubic structure.

Baryte.name: Baryte
Baryte.description: The best specimens resemble a desert rose.

Calcite.name: Calcite
Calcite.description: This yellow crystal is speckled with shimmering nodules.

Dolomite.name: Dolomite
Dolomite.description: It can occur in coral reefs, often near an underwater volcano.

Esperite.name: Esperite
Esperite.description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated.

Fluorapatite.name: Fluorapatite
Fluorapatite.description: Small amounts are found in human teeth.

Helvite.name: Helvite
Helvite.description: It grows in a triangular column.

Jamborite.name: Jamborite
Jamborite.description: The crystals are so tightly packed it almost looks fuzzy.

Jagoite.name: Jagoite
Jagoite.description: A high volume of tiny crystals makes it very glittery.

Kyanite.name: Kyanite
Kyanite.description: The geometric faces are as smooth as glass.

Lunarite.name: Lunarite
Lunarite.description: The cratered white orbs form a tight cluster.

Malachite.name: Malachite
Malachite.description: A popular ornamental stone, used in sculpture and to make green paint.

Neptunite.name: Neptunite
Neptunite.description: A jet-black crystal that is unusually reflective.

Lemon Stone.name: Lemon Stone
Lemon Stone.description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarvish delicacy.

Nekoite.name: Nekoite
Nekoite.description: The delicate shards form a tiny pink meadow.

Orpiment.name: Orpiment
Orpiment.description: Despite its high toxicity, this Mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.

Petrified Slime.name: Petrified Slime
Petrified Slime.description: This little guy may be 100,000 years old.

Thunder Egg.name: Thunder Egg
Thunder Egg.description: According to legend, angry thunder spirits would throw these stones at one another.

Ocean Stone.name: Ocean Stone
Ocean Stone.description: An old legend claims these stones are the mosaics of ancient mermaids.

Ghost Crystal.name: Ghost Crystal
Ghost Crystal.description: There is an aura of coldness around this crystal.

Jasper.name: Jasper
Jasper.description: When polished, this stone becomes attractively luminous. Prized by ancient peoples for thousands of years.

Celestine.name: Celestine
Celestine.description: Some early life forms had bones made from this.

Marble.name: Marble
Marble.description: A very popular material for sculptures and construction.

Sandstone.name: Sandstone
Sandstone.description: A common type of stone with red and brown striations.

Granite.name: Granite
Granite.description: A speckled Mineral that is commonly used in construction.

Limestone.name: Limestone
Limestone.description: A very common type of stone. It's not worth very much.

Soapstone.name: Soapstone
Soapstone.description: Because of its relatively soft consistency, this stone is very popular for carving.

Hematite.name: Hematite
Hematite.description: An iron-based Mineral with interesting magnetic properties.

Mudstone.name: Mudstone
Mudstone.description: A fine-grained rock made from ancient clay or mud.

Obsidian.name: Obsidian
Obsidian.description: A volcanic glass that forms when lava cools rapidly.

Slate.name: Slate
Slate.description: It's extremely resistant to water, making it a good roofing material.

Fairy Stone.name: Fairy Stone
Fairy Stone.description: An old miner's song suggests these are made from the bones of ancient fairies.

Star Shards.name: Star Shards
Star Shards.description: No one knows how these form. Some scientists claim that the microscopic structure displays unnatural regularity.

Geode.name: Geode
Geode.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

Frozen Geode.name: Frozen Geode
Frozen Geode.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

Magma Geode.name: Magma Geode
Magma Geode.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

Omni Geode.name: Omni Geode
Omni Geode.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you. These geodes contain a wide variety of Minerals.
